text:
Hello everyone, happy holidays!
I am having some issues with the HubDB , I keep running into a typeerror, the code is the following:
`batch_input_hub_db_table_row_v_3_request = BatchInputHubDbTableRowV3Request(inputs=[{"values":{"text_column":"sample text value"}}])`
try:
    api_response = client.cms.hubdb.rows_batch_api.batch_create_draft_table_rows(table_id_or_name=“4708328", batch_input_hub_db_table_row_v_3_request=batch_input_hub_db_table_row_v_3_request)
    pprint(api_response)
except ApiException as e:
    print(“Exception when calling rows_batch_api->batch_create_draft_table_rows: %s\n” % e)

The error message is: TypeError: RowsBatchApi.batch_create_draft_table_rows() missing 1 required positional argument: ‘batch_input_hub_db_table_row_v3_request’ , but I cannot see what argument I am missing

Hello! Does anyone know if it is now possible in v3/v4 of associations to create the association using a unique property rather than the hs_object_id? I tried searching, but couldn't find clarity. Evidently the dev docs are not very clear on when it can or can't be used and how given they just say due to certain limitations it doesn't appear in the endpoints tab...
hey mates! I need to install Hubris and it wants API key. How should I get it?
<@U039FTRBQ93> thanks, we will try without @ then, will just use <http://cloudeagle.ai|cloudeagle.ai>
Hello everyone, Is there a way to know if a company is active or inactive?
You can find available properties to search for contacts from `<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/properties/contacts>`
Think they do it like that because you might have custom properties you can search on.
you could send the email in a url query and then do a forms api form submission (super simple ajax call) on that redirect page, after submission, continue the redirect.

yeah .. doing a “fake” forms submission was one option .. we now moved the “download” page over to the system that handles the login (ie. has the email) and we use the HubSpot widget to send the email on that page
ahh nice!
Is that a property you are trying to get from Company records? :thinking_face: Could you specify more what you mean as "active"?
Sure, I have a list of companies and I don’t know if it’s possible to deactivate or disable them, that’s why I was asking if there is any property to know if it’s enabled or not

i think you will need to decide what qualifies as “inactive”.   if it something like an engagement, you can do a search using `hs_last_sales_activity_type` as a property to filter by
unsure if this is a useful property for you, but maybe :shrug:
you could look at all available properties and decide on which one works for you
<https://api.HubSpot.com/crm/v3/properties/companies>
api keys are no longer supported.  I would contact them and see if they have updated there authentication methods.
Thanks
By disabling, do you mean deleting the record? is that list from a HS export? :thinking_face:
Know we talked about this so don't have too much more to add but this is the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/understanding-the-crm|doc> I found on it:
Basically just says you can get specific record using that a unique id property
no, I don’t want to delete, I want to have the company but just deseable

I would look into lists
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/lists/create-active-or-static-lists|https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/lists/create-active-or-static-lists>
Just need to establish what qualifies as not active
